section.p: As of an April 16 order from the governor, all schools in New York state are conducting remote learning through May 15.
School closure information | Remote learning | Child care for essential workers | Student and family support

div.p: As of an April 16 order from the governor, all schools in New York state are closed through May 15.
Remote learning | Child care for essential workers | Student and family support
During the school closure, our staff is still here to support you. Students, families and staff members visiting our school buildings during the closure are asked to follow these procedures:

ul.li: Limit the number of people entering the building to the smallest number possible
Practice social distancing while inside the school building

li.strong: Anyone entering the building must wear a mask or face covering

div.p: We recommend that you call the school before visiting, if possible, to ensure that we will be ready to assist you at the time of your visit. If you are not already receiving email messages from the district, please contact us so that we can add your email address to our distribution list.

p.em: Do you have questions that aren’t answered here? Please email the webmaster or contact us via social media (Facebook, Twitter, Instagram). We will do our best to get you the information you need.

div.p: Students and their families can pick up bagged meals from 11 to 11:30 a.m. weekdays during the school closure. Meals can be picked up from the East Herkimer Fire Department and the front entrance of Herkimer High School. In addition, buses will distribute food at the following locations:

ul.li: Herkimer Public Library on Main Street

div.p: There is no charge to families for this service. Families are asked to
Any family who is need of a meal, but cannot access one of these sites, is asked to contact the main office at (315) 866-2230.

Child care placement is available to personnel who provide essential services, supplies, or support during this time. If you believe that you may qualify, please call the Oneida-Herkimer-Madison Child Care Resource Center at 315-223-7850 extension 222 or email earlycareandlearning@cornell.edu.
The most current and accurate information about the coronavirus can be found at www.health.ny.gov/diseases/communicable/coronavirus.
Additional information is available from the Centers for Disease Control: https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/index.html
Both of these websites are being updated regularly as new information develops.
